pros: The CCA has ensured the switch to working from home during the pandemic was seamless and that we are supported. My manager will make time for discussions on projects I am working on and provides continuous feedback the same as before, when it was an open door policy.
cons: The CCA has incorporated some great team building and social activities remotely but it is not that same as in-person activities. Can't wait for a time when we can be together at the office again safely.

pros: Small shop, fast paced, good talent.
cons: Turnaround is high for the nfp market

pros: Benefits are decent, good work life balance, talented staff
cons: Hostile work environment, blatant favouritism and nepotism by senior management, high turnover

pros: Salary, office location, benefits, and professional development funding.
cons: In the one year I spent there, over half of the staff turned over (a combo of quitting and firing). They like to focus on 'work culture' but it is really more of a CULTture. Lots of nepotism, toxic management styles, and interpersonal drama.

pros: The CEO and senior staffs are awesome. They are incredible leaders and really value everyone's opinion and time. Everyone was so friendly. It felt like being part of a family. I was so sad to leave. I made friends that I think I will keep for a very long time. It was by far the best place I worked at. I had a great time there and would definitely recommend it.
cons: No cons, I loved working there.

pros: Incredibly talented, warm, and welcoming staff.  The work is very valuable, and the office really is a team environment.
cons: Things can get very busy, and there is at times some red tape through which to navigate.  Being a small organization, career growth potential is tough...and that's no fault of theirs.

pros: I have been at the organization longer than 2 years and never had any performance discussion with my manager. I don't believe that the first review was inflammatory as it seems to contain true facts that I have also witnessed.
cons: It's okay if you want to save face, but don't do it at the expense of your members. As a Chiropractor I do not believe you have represented my interests at all.

pros: This is a great way for students to get involved in the profession and get ahead in their career
cons: It takes up a little time during your internship year
